text:
I saw the PR for changing single to double quotes. I’m just throwing this out for discussion, but do double quotes inside of double quotes freak anyone else out? :sweat_smile:
For example:
```rel="{{ rel|join(" ") }}"```

Yeah :sweat_smile: I think we have been running into it on both ends (e.g. `{% set example = 'I don\'t love this' %}`). In the case above it technically works because the HubL will be successfully run first. We did tweak the style guide to say that it makes sense to use single quotes in HubL depending on the situation. Do you think it would make more sense for your specific example to follow `rel="{{ rel|join(' ') }}"` so it is easier on the eye/less scary?

I usually do single inside of single for HubL, but yeah I've just recently changed to double inside of single for things like that, since I have had some issues with single quotes not working correctly with HubL in complex sitations. Concatting seems to be the safest option 100% of the time though.

> Do you think it would make more sense for your specific example to follow `rel="{{ rel|join(' ') }}"` so it is easier on the eye/less scary?
YES PLEASE lol
Honestly I think that’ll be a style guideline I don’t follow :sweat_smile:. Jinja has preferred single quotes for so long, so I think I’ll stick to tried and true here
Then again, even their docs are mixed with both :man-shrugging::skin-tone-2:  … this is tough
If only we could use backticks like in JS. I prefer to always use single, backticks if single can't cut it.
